metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7555 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Augeas versions up to and including 1.8.0 are vulnerable to heap-based buffer overflow due to improper handling of escaped strings. Attacker could send crafted strings that would cause the application using augeas to copy past the end of a buffer, leading to a crash or possible code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7555` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

augeas-lenses - 1.4.0-0ubuntu1.1
augeas-tools - 1.4.0-0ubuntu1.1
libaugeas0 - 1.4.0-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: augeas package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.0-0ubuntu1.1').
